title: Shades of Blue Color: Names, Codes, Meanings and Uses
excerpt: Blue shades range from soft pastels to deep navy, each carrying unique meanings. See their hex codes, symbolism, and practical applications in art, design, and personal style.
content:
Blue is one of the most calming and versatile colors, spanning a spectrum from soft, airy tones to deep, commanding shades. From pale sky blues and powder tones to rich navy and royal blues, each shade carries its own emotion and significance.

Blue is often categorized by undertones, with cool blues like cerulean and azure feeling tranquil and refreshing, while darker, muted blues such as indigo and slate convey stability, depth, and sophistication.

Across design, fashion, and everyday life, blue evokes feelings of trust, serenity, and focus. Its wide range allows it to be soothing, energizing, or authoritative, depending on how it’s applied.

Whether creating a peaceful room, enhancing a stylish outfit, or emphasizing professionalism in branding, blue offers endless possibilities for expression.

Common Shades of Blue

Light/Pastel Blues: Baby Blue, Powder Blue, Sky Blue, Alice Blue, Periwinkle

Bright/Vibrant Blues: Cerulean, Capri, Cyan, Dodger Blue, Electric Blue

Dark/Deep Blues: Navy, Indigo, Prussian Blue, Midnight Blue, Sapphire

Muted/Grayish Blues: Slate Blue, Steel Blue, Teal Blue, Cadet Blue, Denim

Blue-Greens: Turquoise, Aqua, Teal, Cyan, Peacock

This post explores the meanings, symbolism, and practical uses of blue, highlighting how each shade shapes mood, design, and culture.

Alice Blue

Alice Blue (#F0F8FF) is a pale, almost white tint of blue with a very slight gray-green undertone. Its history is directly tied to Alice Roosevelt Longworth, daughter of U.S. President Theodore Roosevelt. Interestingly, she popularized the shade so much it was named for her. This color carries meanings of softness, heritage, and vintage elegance. Consequently, it’s primarily used in historical design projects, vintage fashion, and feminine interiors where a soft, airy feel is desired.

  • HEX #F0F8FF
  • RGB 240, 248, 255
  • CMYK 6, 3, 0, 0

Azure

Azure (#007FFF) is a bright, intense blue that is often described as the color of a clear sky on a sunny day. The name comes from the highly prized lapis lazuli stone, historically ground to make the ultramarine pigment. This color symbolizes clarity, confidence, and communication. Therefore, Azure is effectively used in corporate branding, technology logos, and heraldry to project trust and expansiveness.

  • HEX #007FFF
  • RGB 0, 127, 255
  • CMYK 100, 50, 0, 0

Baby Blue

Baby Blue (#89CFF0) is a very light, soft shade of blue with a gentle, innocent quality. It became culturally prominent in the post-World War II era, especially in baby clothing and nursery decor. This color represents tranquility, innocence, and newborn boys in Western cultures. As a result, Baby Blue is a staple in nursery design, soft spring fashion, and calming product packaging.

  • HEX #89CFF0
  • RGB 137, 207, 240
  • CMYK 43, 14, 0, 6

Baby Blue Eyes

Baby Blue Eyes (#A1CAF1) is a soft, light periwinkle blue with a touch of purple. It is named after the small, delicate wildflower native to California. The color evokes feelings of sweetness, gentleness, and serene grace. Thus, Baby Blue Eyes is commonly used in romantic stationery, floral designs, and pastel-themed art to create a tender, uplifting mood.

  • HEX #A1CAF1
  • RGB 161, 202, 241
  • CMYK 33, 16, 0, 5

Blue Bell

Blue Bell (#A2A2D0) is a light shade of blue-gray with a distinct lavender undertone, reminiscent of the bluebell flower. It is a dusty, muted tone that feels both nostalgic and calm. This color suggests tranquility, modesty, and wistful memory. Consequently, Blue Bell is often chosen for shabby chic interiors, vintage fabric patterns, and dreamy landscape paintings.

  • HEX #A2A2D0
  • RGB 162, 162, 208
  • CMYK 22, 22, 0, 18

Blue Gray

Blue Gray (#6699CC) is a medium desaturated blend of blue and gray, evoking the color of a cloudy sky or weathered stone. It is a practical, timeless shade that avoids being overly bright or cold. This color embodies dependability, neutrality, and calm stability. Therefore, Blue Gray is frequently used in professional office decor, men’s suiting, and modern architectural accents.

  • HEX #6699CC
  • RGB 102, 153, 204
  • CMYK 50, 25, 0, 20

Blue Jeans

Blue Jeans (#1560BD) is a strong, classic medium blue that mirrors the iconic color of traditional denim fabric. It is directly tied to the invention of Levi Strauss’s durable work pants. This color symbolizes casual reliability, hard work, and timeless Americana. As a result, Blue Jeans is ubiquitous in casual fashion, uniform design, and rustic or vintage branding.

  • HEX #1560BD
  • RGB 21, 96, 189
  • CMYK 89, 49, 0, 26

Blue Lagoon

Blue Lagoon (#5E8C9A) is a muted blue-green teal that captures the color of a deep, serene tropical lagoon. It is a sophisticated, natural tone that feels both refreshing and grounded. This color suggests escape, tranquility, and natural depth. Consequently, Blue Lagoon is ideal for spa and wellness branding, tropical resort decor, and nature-inspired art.

  • HEX #5E8C9A
  • RGB 94, 140, 154
  • CMYK 39, 9, 0, 40

Blue Sapphire

Blue Sapphire (#126180) is a deep, rich blue directly inspired by the precious sapphire gemstone. It is a formal and luxurious shade, darker than royal blue. This color represents wisdom, nobility, and divine favor. Thus, Blue Sapphire is used in high-end jewelry branding, formal evening wear, and designs requiring an aura of prestige and seriousness.

  • HEX #126180
  • RGB 18, 97, 128
  • CMYK 86, 24, 0, 50

Blue Yonder

Blue Yonder (#5072A7) is a muted medium azure with a slight gray undertone, named for the phrase “into the wild blue yonder.” It evokes the expansive sky seen by aviators. This color conveys adventure, freedom, and nostalgic aspiration. As a result, Blue Yonder is effective in aviation themes, outdoor apparel logos, and designs aiming for a friendly, trustworthy feel.

  • HEX #5072A7
  • RGB 80, 114, 167
  • CMYK 52, 32, 0, 35

Bright Navy Blue

Bright Navy Blue (#1974D2) is a vibrant, saturated blue that is significantly brighter and more electric than traditional navy. It updates the classic nautical shade with modern intensity. This color symbolizes confidence, dynamic energy, and maritime vitality. Consequently, it is used in sports team graphics, contemporary tech interfaces, and bold fashion statements to command attention.

  • HEX #1974D2
  • RGB 25, 116, 210
  • CMYK 88, 45, 0, 18

Capri

Capri (#00BFFF) is a deep, vivid sky blue named after the color of the sea around the Italian island of Capri. It is a bright, sunny, and intensely saturated shade. This color evokes Mediterranean vacations, clear waters, and joyful brightness. Therefore, Capri is perfect for summer marketing, swimwear design, and any project needing a punch of lively blue.

  • HEX #00BFFF
  • RGB 0, 191, 255
  • CMYK 100, 25, 0, 0

Carolina Blue

Carolina Blue (#4B9CD3) is a soft, medium sky blue famously associated with the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill. It is a specific, trademarked shade of cerulean. This color represents school pride, Southern heritage, and friendly competition. As a result, it is dominantly used in university merchandise, athletic uniforms, and regional pride designs in North Carolina.

  • HEX #4B9CD3
  • RGB 75, 156, 211
  • CMYK 64, 26, 0, 17

Celeste

Celeste (#B2FFFF) is a very pale, almost ethereal tint of cyan, whose name is Italian for “sky blue” or “heavenly.” It is lighter and more icy than traditional sky blue. This color suggests lightness, serenity, and icy coolness. Thus, Celeste is often chosen for winter-themed designs, frosty cosmetic packaging, and backgrounds needing a hint of cool color without weight.

  • HEX #B2FFFF
  • RGB 178, 255, 255
  • CMYK 30, 0, 0, 0

Cerulean

Cerulean (#007BA7) is a deep-to-medium sky blue, taking its name from the Latin word for “sky” or “heaven.” The pigment was historically a costly cobalt stannate. This color embodies openness, clarity, and peaceful expanse. Consequently, Cerulean is widely used in artistic works, design accents, and branding to evoke a sense of calm, clean depth.

  • HEX #007BA7
  • RGB 0, 123, 167
  • CMYK 100, 26, 0, 35

Cobalt Blue

Cobalt Blue (#0047AB) is an intense, saturated medium blue with a slight violet undertone, originally made from cobalt aluminate. Historically, it was a costly and prized pigment for fine art and porcelain. This color represents unique brilliance, stability, and a touch of regal energy. Therefore, it is a favorite in artist’s pigments, ceramic glazes, and bold statement pieces in fashion and design.

  • HEX #0047AB
  • RGB 0, 71, 171
  • CMYK 100, 58, 0, 33

Columbia Blue

Columbia Blue (#B9D9EB) is a very pale, grayish sky blue named after Columbia University. It is a soft, powdery, and academic shade. This color suggests intelligence, serenity, and institutional tradition. Consequently, Columbia Blue is used in university branding, vintage sports uniforms, and designs requiring a subdued, trustworthy blue.

  • HEX #B9D9EB
  • RGB 185, 217, 235
  • CMYK 21, 8, 0, 8

Cornflower Blue

Cornflower Blue (#6495ED) is a soft, medium-light blue with a slight purple hint, named after the vibrant Centaurea cyanus flower. It was the favorite color of Dutch painter Johannes Vermeer. This color embodies delicate beauty, simplicity, and calm contentment. Thus, it is popular in country-style decor, floral arrangements, and web design for a friendly, approachable feel.

  • HEX #6495ED
  • RGB 100, 149, 237
  • CMYK 58, 37, 0, 7

Cyan

Cyan (#00FFFF) is a vibrant, electric greenish-blue that is one of the four primary colors in the CMYK color model. It is identical to the web color Aqua. This color signifies clarity, freshness, and technological precision. As a result, Cyan is essential in color printing, digital design interfaces, and medical or scientific visuals for its clean, sharp appearance.

  • HEX #00FFFF
  • RGB 0, 255, 255
  • CMYK 100, 0, 0, 0

Dark Blue

Dark Blue (#00008B) is a deep, intense shade of pure blue, significantly darker than navy but without its blackness. It is one of the oldest and most fundamental blue dyes. This color conveys knowledge, power, integrity, and seriousness. Consequently, Dark Blue is a cornerstone of corporate logos, professional attire, and formal designs requiring authority and trust.

  • HEX #00008B
  • RGB 0, 0, 139
  • CMYK 100, 100, 0, 45

Denim

Denim (#1560BD) is a strong, classic medium blue that mirrors the iconic color of traditional indigo-dyed denim fabric. It is directly tied to the invention of Levi Strauss’s durable work pants. This color symbolizes casual reliability, hard work, and timeless Americana. As a result, Denim is ubiquitous in casual fashion, uniform design, and rustic or vintage branding.

  • HEX #1560BD
  • RGB 21, 96, 189
  • CMYK 89, 49, 0, 26

Dodger Blue

Dodger Blue (#1E90FF) is a bright, vivid azure named after the Los Angeles Dodgers baseball team. It is a slightly green-tinged, energetic blue. This color evokes team spirit, sunny optimism, and sporting excitement. Therefore, Dodger Blue is effectively used in sports merchandise, vibrant graphics, and designs aiming for a friendly, energetic, and all-American vibe.

  • HEX #1E90FF
  • RGB 30, 144, 255
  • CMYK 88, 44, 0, 0

Egyptian Blue

Egyptian Blue (#1034A6) is a rich, opaque pigment that was the first synthetic blue color ever created, used anciently in Egyptian art and artifacts. It is a deep, slightly violet blue. This color represents ancient mystery, sacred protection, and historical innovation. Consequently, it is used in historical recreations, themed designs, and artwork to evoke antiquity and luxury.

  • HEX #1034A6
  • RGB 16, 52, 166
  • CMYK 90, 69, 0, 35

Electric Blue

Electric Blue (#7DF9FF) is an intensely bright, glowing cyan-blue that seems to emit its own light, reminiscent of electrical sparks or neon signs. It is a very cool, saturated shade. This color symbolizes high voltage energy, futuristic technology, and vibrant nightlife. Thus, Electric Blue is dominant in sci-fi themes, club lighting, and extreme sports branding for its eye-popping effect.

  • HEX #7DF9FF
  • RGB 125, 249, 255
  • CMYK 51, 2, 0, 0

French Blue

French Blue (#0072BB) is a clear, vivid medium blue often associated with French heraldry and sporting kits. It is a classic, strong azure. This color conveys national pride, elegance, and maritime tradition. As a result, French Blue is used in sports uniforms, nautical flags, and classic design to project a sense of refined strength and heritage.

  • HEX #0072BB
  • RGB 0, 114, 187
  • CMYK 100, 39, 0, 27

Glacier Blue

Glacier Blue (#78B1BF) is a soft, grayish-greenish blue that mimics the color of ancient, compressed ice in a glacier. It is a cool, muted, and tranquil shade. This color evokes extreme cold, pristine nature, and serene isolation. Therefore, Glacier Blue is ideal for environmental campaigns, winter travel branding, and spa design to create a calming, cool atmosphere.

  • HEX #78B1BF
  • RGB 120, 177, 191
  • CMYK 37, 7, 0, 25

Ice Blue

Ice Blue (#99FFFF) is a very pale, luminous tint of cyan that looks like sunlit ice or pure, frozen water. It is lighter and brighter than glacier blue. This color suggests fragility, clarity, and chilling freshness. Consequently, Ice Blue is commonly used in winter fashion, cosmetic packaging for “cooling” products, and digital backgrounds needing a frosty accent.

  • HEX #99FFFF
  • RGB 153, 255, 255
  • CMYK 40, 0, 0, 0

Indigo

Indigo (#4B0082) is a deep, rich color between blue and violet on the spectrum, historically derived from the plant of the same name. It is the traditional dye used for denim. This color represents intuition, wisdom, and depth of spirit. As a result, Indigo is used in spiritual and wellness design, bohemian fashion, and as a dramatic, sophisticated dark accent.

  • HEX #4B0082
  • RGB 75, 0, 130
  • CMYK 42, 100, 0, 49

Iris Blue

Iris Blue (#5A4FCF) is a bright, medium purple-blue inspired by the iris flower. It sits distinctly between periwinkle and royal blue. This color symbolizes royalty, eloquence, and cherished friendship. Thus, Iris Blue is chosen for floral designs, creative branding, and artistic projects where a vibrant yet refined blue-purple is needed.

  • HEX #5A4FCF
  • RGB 90, 79, 207
  • CMYK 57, 62, 0, 19

Light Blue

Light Blue (#ADD8E6) is a pale tint of blue, widely recognized as the generic name for any soft, airy blue. It is a simple, peaceful, and common shade. This color embodies calmness, openness, and gentle masculinity. Consequently, Light Blue is a versatile choice for baby products, summer themes, website backgrounds, and healthcare environments.

  • HEX #ADD8E6
  • RGB 173, 216, 230
  • CMYK 25, 6, 0, 10

Light Cyan

Light Cyan (#E0FFFF) is an extremely pale, whitened shade of cyan, almost indistinguishable from a very light blue. It is the lightest tint in the cyan family. This color suggests purity, cold light, and sterility. Therefore, Light Cyan is primarily used as a background color in digital design, in medical or scientific visuals, and for creating icy, futuristic effects.

  • HEX #E0FFFF
  • RGB 224, 255, 255
  • CMYK 12, 0, 0, 0

Light Sky Blue

Light Sky Blue (#87CEFA) is a soft, warm blue that captures the hue of a daytime sky near the horizon. It is lighter and gentler than standard sky blue. This color evokes serenity, optimism, and a gentle summer day. Consequently, it is a popular choice for nursery walls, calming app interfaces, and designs meant to feel friendly and inviting.

  • HEX #87CEFA
  • RGB 135, 206, 250
  • CMYK 46, 18, 0, 2

Light Steel Blue

Light Steel Blue (#B0C4DE) is a pale, cool grayish blue that resembles weathered, brushed steel. It is a muted, metallic, and neutral shade. This color conveys industrial durability, cool modernity, and subdued strength. Thus, Light Steel Blue is effective in tech product design, modern architectural palettes, and gender-neutral themes.

  • HEX #B0C4DE
  • RGB 176, 196, 222
  • CMYK 21, 12, 0, 13

Majorelle Blue

Majorelle Blue (#6050DC) is an intense, vivid ultramarine blue created and used extensively by French painter Jacques Majorelle in his Marrakech garden. It is a striking, almost electric shade with a purple undertone. This color represents artistic boldness, exotic beauty, and vibrant energy. As a result, it is used in bohemian decor, fashion accents, and artistic designs for a dramatic pop of color.

  • HEX #6050DC
  • RGB 96, 80, 220
  • CMYK 56, 64, 0, 14

Maya Blue

Maya Blue (#73C2FB) is a bright, azure blue historically made by mixing indigo dye with a special clay, used by Mesoamerican cultures like the Maya. It is remarkably resistant to fading. This color symbolizes ancient ritual, cultural resilience, and bright sky deities. Therefore, Maya Blue appears in historical art reproductions, cultural crafts, and vibrant folk art designs.

  • HEX #73C2FB
  • RGB 115, 194, 251
  • CMYK 54, 23, 0, 2

Medium Blue

Medium Blue (#0000CD) is a pure, saturated blue halfway between dark blue and bright blue on the color wheel. It is the archetypal “blue” most people visualize. This color represents reliability, straightforwardness, and common sense. Consequently, Medium Blue is a fundamental, versatile choice for corporate logos, instructional diagrams, and any design requiring a clear, unambiguous blue.

  • HEX #0000CD
  • RGB 0, 0, 205
  • CMYK 100, 100, 0, 20

Medium Slate Blue

Medium Slate Blue (#7B68EE) is a medium-purplish blue with a grayish (slate) tone, sitting between blue and violet. It is a muted yet distinct shade. This color suggests creative thought, subtlety, and dignified calm. Thus, it is often used in creative software UI design, artistic websites, and interiors seeking a sophisticated, slightly unconventional cool color.

  • HEX #7B68EE
  • RGB 123, 104, 238
  • CMYK 48, 56, 0, 7

Medium Turquoise

Medium Turquoise (#48D1CC) is a balanced, greenish-blue cyan reminiscent of the turquoise gemstone. It is brighter and more saturated than teal. This color embodies emotional balance, spiritual healing, and communication. Therefore, Medium Turquoise is popular in jewelry design, spa and wellness branding, and retro/vintage graphics from the 1950s.

  • HEX #48D1CC
  • RGB 72, 209, 204
  • CMYK 66, 0, 2, 18

Midnight Blue

Midnight Blue (#191970) is an extremely dark shade of blue, nearly black, named for the color of a moonless night sky. It is more colorful and less flat than pure black. This color conveys mystery, elegance, and the vastness of space. As a result, Midnight Blue is used for formal evening wear, astronomy themes, and luxury product packaging for a deep, refined darkness.

  • HEX #191970
  • RGB 25, 25, 112
  • CMYK 78, 78, 0, 56

Navy Blue

Navy Blue (#000080) is a very dark shade of blue, traditionally used in the uniforms of many world navies, hence the name. It is essentially black mixed with blue. This color symbolizes authority, stability, and tradition. Consequently, Navy Blue is a cornerstone of professional uniforms, classic business suits, and conservative, trustworthy branding.

  • HEX #000080
  • RGB 0, 0, 128
  • CMYK 100, 100, 0, 50

Neon Blue

Neon Blue (#1F51FF) is a brilliantly intense, glowing blue that mimics the light emitted by certain neon signs. It is a vivid, electric shade with a slight violet tinge. This color represents futuristic energy, nightlife, and digital vibrancy. Therefore, Neon Blue is dominant in club graphics, cyberpunk art, athletic wear, and any design meant to appear ultra-modern and attention-grabbing.

  • HEX #1F51FF
  • RGB 31, 81, 255
  • CMYK 88, 68, 0, 0

Ocean Blue

Ocean Blue (#4F42B5) is a deep, muted blue with a strong purple undertone, capturing the color of the deep sea under a cloudy sky. It is a rich, somewhat somber shade. This color evokes depth, mystery, and the profound unknown. Consequently, Ocean Blue is used in marine biology themes, dramatic seascape art, and designs requiring a sense of deep, calm power.

  • HEX #4F42B5
  • RGB 79, 66, 181
  • CMYK 56, 64, 0, 29

Pacific Blue

Pacific Blue (#1CA9C9) is a strong, clear cyan-blue reminiscent of tropical Pacific Ocean waters. It is brighter and more saturated than teal. This color suggests adventure, tropical clarity, and refreshing coolness. Thus, Pacific Blue is effective for travel and tourism branding, swimwear, and outdoor gear logos to convey a sense of vibrant, aquatic escape.

  • HEX #1CA9C9
  • RGB 28, 169, 201
  • CMYK 86, 16, 0, 21

Pale Blue

Pale Blue (#AFEEEE) is a very light, whitened tint of cyan, also known as “Pale Turquoise.” It is a soft, airy, and neutral cool color. This color embodies delicacy, cleanliness, and a whisper of coolness. As a result, Pale Blue is a common choice for hospital linens, bathroom decor, wedding themes, and backgrounds where a hint of color is needed without intensity.

  • HEX #AFEEEE
  • RGB 175, 238, 238
  • CMYK 26, 0, 0, 7

Peacock Blue

Peacock Blue (#026873) is a dark, greenish-blue inspired by the eye of a peacock feather. It is a deep, rich, and luxurious tone. This color symbolizes opulence, integrity, and vibrant life. Consequently, Peacock Blue is used in high-end fashion, jewelry design, and elegant interior accents for a dramatic, nature-inspired statement.

  • HEX #026873
  • RGB 2, 104, 115
  • CMYK 98, 10, 0, 55

Periwinkle

Periwinkle (#CCCCFF) is a pale, lilac-blue tint, named after the small violet-blue flower. It sits softly between blue and purple on the color wheel. This color suggests nostalgia, tender friendship, and early spring. Therefore, Periwinkle is widely used in feminine designs, Easter decorations, and soft, romantic aesthetics to create a gentle, soothing mood.

  • HEX #CCCCFF
  • RGB 204, 204, 255
  • CMYK 20, 20, 0, 0

Picton Blue

Picton Blue (#45B1E8) is a bright, cheerful azure named after the town of Picton in New Zealand, known for its picturesque harbor. It is a vibrant, clean, and friendly shade. This color evokes maritime leisure, clear skies, and optimistic energy. As a result, Picton Blue is popular in nautical flags, sportswear, and children’s toys for its lively, approachable feel.

  • HEX #45B1E8
  • RGB 69, 177, 232
  • CMYK 70, 24, 0, 9

Powder Blue

Powder Blue (#B0E0E6) is a very pale, dusty blue with a slightly grayish or whitened appearance, reminiscent of powdered bleach or laundry bluing. It is a soft, vintage-feeling shade. This color represents gentleness, calmness, and bygone eras. Consequently, Powder Blue is a staple in vintage fashion, baby clothing, and shabby chic interior design.

  • HEX #B0E0E6
  • RGB 176, 224, 230
  • CMYK 23, 3, 0, 10

Prussian Blue

Prussian Blue (#003153) is a very dark, intense blue historically discovered accidentally in Berlin in the early 1700s. It was the first modern synthetic pigment. This color embodies depth, sophistication, and scientific discovery. Thus, Prussian Blue is used in technical drawings (blueprints), historical painting reproductions, and deep, dramatic design accents.

  • HEX #003153
  • RGB 0, 49, 83
  • CMYK 100, 41, 0, 67

Royal Blue

Royal Blue (#4169E1) is a rich, vivid medium to dark blue, traditionally associated with royalty, specifically the British royal family. It is brighter and less purple than navy. This color signifies nobility, excellence, and superiority. Therefore, Royal Blue is used for awards ribbons, formal attire, and high-impact branding to convey prestige and quality.

  • HEX #4169E1
  • RGB 65, 105, 225
  • CMYK 71, 53, 0, 12

Robin Egg Blue

Robin Egg Blue (#96DED1) is a soft, greenish-blue cyan that perfectly matches the color of an American robin’s egg. It is a pale, calming, and distinctly spring-like shade. This color symbolizes new beginnings, fertility, and gentle renewal. Consequently, it is a beloved choice for Easter designs, spring wedding themes, and nursery decor to evoke freshness and hope.

  • HEX #96DED1
  • RGB 150, 222, 209
  • CMYK 32, 0, 6, 13

Sapphire

Sapphire (#0F52BA) is a deep, saturated blue directly inspired by the precious sapphire gemstone. It is typically a purer, brighter blue than its Blue Sapphire variant. This color represents wisdom, virtue, and divine favor. Thus, Sapphire is used in luxury jewelry branding, high-fashion accents, and designs requiring a gemstone’s association with truth and royalty.

  • HEX #0F52BA
  • RGB 15, 82, 186
  • CMYK 92, 56, 0, 27

Sea Blue

Sea Blue (#006994) is a strong, dark cyan that captures the color of the open ocean under bright sunlight. It is deeper and more green-tinged than navy. This color evokes adventure, depth, and maritime power. Therefore, Sea Blue is effective in nautical equipment, marine conservation logos, and travel advertising for exotic destinations.

  • HEX #006994
  • RGB 0, 105, 148
  • CMYK 100, 29, 0, 42

Sky Blue

Sky Blue (#87CEEB) is the quintessential light azure blue of a clear, unclouded daytime sky. It is a bright, pure, and optimistic shade. This color embodies openness, freedom, and serenity. As a result, Sky Blue is universally used in children’s products, healthcare logos, and web design to create a friendly, trustworthy, and calming impression.

  • HEX #87CEEB
  • RGB 135, 206, 235
  • CMYK 43, 12, 0, 8

Slate Blue

Slate Blue (#6A5ACD) is a medium desaturated blue with a strong gray (slate) and purple undertone. It is a dusty, muted, and sophisticated shade. This color suggests intelligence, subtlety, and reserved elegance. Consequently, Slate Blue is chosen for professional website themes, academic regalia, and muted fashion palettes.

  • CMYK 48, 56, 0, 20
  • HEX #6A5ACD
  • RGB 106, 90, 205

Steel Blue

Steel Blue (#4682B4) is a moderate blue with strong gray undertones, resembling the color of steel that has been blued for passivation. It is a sturdy, industrial, and cool shade. This color conveys resilience, reliability, and no-nonsense practicality. Therefore, Steel Blue is commonly used in automotive industries, technical tool branding, and corporate designs seeking a strong, masculine feel.

  • HEX #4682B4
  • RGB 70, 130, 180
  • CMYK 61, 28, 0, 29

Storm Blue

Storm Blue (#4B6C8C) is a dark, grayish-blue that mimics the color of heavy storm clouds or a turbulent sea. It is a somber, powerful, and brooding shade. This color evokes impending change, raw power, and dramatic tension. Consequently, Storm Blue is used in weather-related graphics, dramatic landscape art, and designs aiming for a moody, atmospheric depth.

  • HEX #4B6C8C
  • RGB 75, 108, 140
  • CMYK 46, 23, 0, 45

Teal Blue

Teal Blue (#367588) is a medium to dark blue-green, darker and more balanced than turquoise. It is named after the common teal duck, which has a distinctive stripe of this color on its head. This color represents sophistication, emotional balance, and uniqueness. Thus, Teal Blue is popular in 90s retro designs, modern home decor, and branding for its distinctive, calming presence.

  • HEX #367588
  • RGB 54, 117, 136
  • CMYK 60, 14, 0, 47

Tiffany Blue

Tiffany Blue (#81D8D0) is a light, medium robin egg blue trademarked by Tiffany & Co. jewelry. It is a specific, culturally iconic shade of cyan. This color symbolizes exclusive luxury, romantic gift-giving, and timeless style. As a result, it is almost exclusively used by Tiffany & Co. but is widely referenced in fashion and design for its association with elegance.

  • HEX #81D8D0
  • RGB 129, 216, 208
  • CMYK 40, 0, 4, 15

True Blue

True Blue (#0073CF) is a strong, pure blue that is meant to represent the ideal concept of “blue” without purple or green tints. It is a vivid, loyal, and straightforward shade. This color embodies loyalty, steadfastness, and patriotism. Consequently, True Blue is often used in national flags, police uniforms, and team sports branding to convey unwavering trust and unity.

  • HEX #0073CF
  • RGB 0, 115, 207
  • CMYK 100, 44, 0, 19

Turquoise Blue

Turquoise Blue (#40E0D0) is a bright, greenish-blue cyan named after the gemstone, evoking tropical waters. It is more vibrant and saturated than teal. This color represents vivacity, spiritual grounding, and communication. Therefore, Turquoise Blue is a staple in Southwestern art, bohemian jewelry, and retro/vintage design for its cheerful, uplifting energy.

  • HEX #40E0D0
  • RGB 64, 224, 208
  • CMYK 71, 0, 7, 12

Ultramarine

Ultramarine (#120A8F) is a deep, brilliant blue originally made from the semi-precious stone lapis lazuli, which was “ultra marine” (beyond the sea) in origin. It was more precious than gold in Renaissance art. This color symbolizes perfection, grandeur, and historical significance. Consequently, Ultramarine is used in fine art, religious iconography, and designs requiring a rich, classic blue.

  • HEX #120A8F
  • RGB 18, 10, 143
  • CMYK 87, 93, 0, 44

Verdigris Blue

Verdigris Blue (#43B3AE) is a greenish-blue that mimics the natural patina formed on copper, brass, or bronze. It is a weathered, historic, and organic shade. This color suggests age, antiquity, and the beauty of decay. Thus, Verdigris Blue is used in historical restoration, steampunk aesthetics, and art to create an aged, classical, or oxidized effect.

  • HEX #43B3AE
  • RGB 67, 179, 174
  • CMYK 63, 0, 3, 30

Vivid Sky Blue

Vivid Sky Blue (#00CCFF) is an intense, highly saturated cyan-blue, brighter than standard sky blue. It is a bold, clean, and energetic shade. This color evokes youthful energy, digital brightness, and cloudless days. As a result, Vivid Sky Blue is dominant in children’s media, sports car graphics, and web design elements meant to pop off the screen.

  • HEX #00CCFF
  • RGB 0, 204, 255
  • CMYK 100, 20, 0, 0

Yale Blue

Yale Blue (#00356B) is a dark azure blue officially used by Yale University since the 1800s. It is a deep, authoritative, and academic shade. This color represents tradition, excellence, and institutional prestige. Consequently, Yale Blue is central to Yale University’s identity and is used in academic regalia, official seals, and collegiate merchandise.

  • HEX #00356B
  • RGB 0, 53, 107
  • CMYK 100, 50, 0, 58

Zaffre

Zaffre (#0014A8) is a deep blue pigment originally made by roasting cobalt ore, used historically in stained glass and pottery glazes. It is a very dark, slightly violet blue. This color embodies antique craftsmanship, alchemical mystery, and rich depth. Therefore, Zaffre appears in historical art techniques, ceramic arts, and deep, luxurious decorative accents.

  • HEX #0014A8
  • RGB 0, 20, 168
  • CMYK 100, 88, 0, 34

Aero Blue

Aero Blue (#C9FFE5) is an extremely pale, cool greenish-blue, almost a tint of aqua. It is a light, airy, and futuristic shade. This color suggests breathability, lightness, and clean technology. Consequently, Aero Blue is used in concept designs for technology, modern spa environments, and packaging for airy or fresh products.

  • HEX #C9FFE5
  • RGB 201, 255, 229
  • CMYK 21, 0, 10, 0

Air Force Blue

Air Force Blue (#5D8AA8) is a grayish medium blue used in the uniforms of various air forces around the world, notably the Royal Air Force. It is a subdued, functional, and authoritative shade. This color represents aerial service, discipline, and sky-bound authority. Thus, it is used in military apparel, aviation-themed designs, and uniforms conveying structured professionalism.

  • HEX #5D8AA8
  • RGB 93, 138, 168
  • CMYK 45, 18, 0, 34

Azure Mist

Azure Mist (#F0FFFF) is a whitened, pale tint of azure, so light it is almost indistinguishable from white. It is the lightest possible shade in the azure family. This color evokes the faintest hint of sky, ethereal lightness, and pristine cold. Therefore, Azure Mist is primarily used as a subtle background color in web and UI design, and in minimalist art for a barely-there coolness.

  • HEX #F0FFFF
  • RGB 240, 255, 255
  • CMYK 6, 0, 0, 0

Baby Navy

Baby Navy (#8BA8B7) is a softened, grayed-down version of traditional navy blue, creating a muted, gentle dark blue. It is a less severe and more contemporary take on the classic. This color suggests quiet sophistication, comfortable tradition, and coastal calm. Consequently, Baby Navy is popular in preppy fashion, relaxed interior design, and nautical themes for a softer look.

  • HEX #8BA8B7
  • RGB 139, 168, 183
  • CMYK 24, 8, 0, 28

Baltic Blue

Baltic Blue (#6D9BC3) is a medium, muted blue with gray undertones, inspired by the often overcast skies and deep waters of the Baltic Sea. It is a cool, serene, and somewhat somber shade. This color evokes Nordic landscapes, maritime calm, and resilient beauty. Therefore, Baltic Blue is used in Scandinavian design, coastal home decor, and apparel for a refined, natural coolness.

  • HEX #6D9BC3
  • RGB 109, 155, 195
  • CMYK 44, 21, 0, 24

Bondi Blue

Bondi Blue (#0095B6) is a vibrant greenish-blue named after the iconic Bondi Beach in Sydney, Australia. It is most famous as the original color of the first iMac G3. This color represents 90s nostalgia, technological playfulness, and refreshing ocean surf. Consequently, Bondi Blue is strongly associated with retro tech design, surf culture branding, and vibrant pop art.

  • HEX #0095B6
  • RGB 0, 149, 182
  • CMYK 100, 18, 0, 29

Bright Cerulean

Bright Cerulean (#02A4D3) is a highly saturated, intense version of cerulean blue. It is a vivid, clean, and eye-catching azure. This color symbolizes clarity, open communication, and vibrant energy. Thus, Bright Cerulean is effective in sports equipment, advertising graphics, and children’s toys where a bold, happy blue is required.

  • HEX #02A4D3
  • RGB 2, 164, 211
  • CMYK 99, 22, 0, 17

Cambridge Blue

Cambridge Blue (#A3C1AD) is a light, grayish greenish-blue traditionally associated with Cambridge University. It is a pale, muted, and academic shade. This color suggests intellectual tradition, sporting rivalry (against Oxford), and understated elegance. As a result, Cambridge Blue is used in university insignia, vintage rowing apparel, and preppy fashion.

  • HEX #A3C1AD
  • RGB 163, 193, 173
  • CMYK 16, 0, 10, 24

China Blue

China Blue (#365194) is a deep, rich medium blue historically used in Chinese blue and white porcelain, like Qinghua ware. It is a cultural and artistic icon. This color represents heritage, fine craftsmanship, and cross-cultural artistry. Therefore, China Blue appears in traditional ceramic patterns, textile designs, and artistic projects evoking Eastern aesthetics.

  • HEX #365194
  • RGB 54, 81, 148
  • CMYK 64, 45, 0, 42

Cyan Blue

Cyan Blue (#0A7E8C) is a moderately dark, greenish-blue that emphasizes the green side of cyan. It is a deep, saturated, and natural-looking aquatic shade. This color evokes tropical lagoons, marine life, and refreshing depth. Consequently, Cyan Blue is used in dive gear branding, aquarium displays, and tropical-themed graphics for a vibrant, watery feel.

  • HEX #0A7E8C
  • RGB 10, 126, 140
  • CMYK 93, 10, 0, 45

Dark Cerulean

Dark Cerulean (#08457E) is a deep, rich version of cerulean, significantly darker and more subdued than its bright counterpart. It retains the characteristic sky-blue essence in a more serious tone. This color suggests dependable wisdom, mature calm, and profound depth. Thus, Dark Cerulean is chosen for professional uniforms, classic automotive paint, and mature branding needing a trustworthy blue.

  • HEX #08457E
  • RGB 8, 69, 126
  • CMYK 94, 45, 0, 51

Dark Cyan

Dark Cyan (#008B8B) is a medium-dark greenish-blue, essentially a deeper shade of the web color cyan. It is the color of dark teal or deep tropical waters. This color represents emotional depth, complexity, and rich vitality. Therefore, Dark Cyan is a popular choice for data visualization charts, sophisticated website themes, and nature-inspired designs.

  • HEX #008B8B
  • RGB 0, 139, 139
  • CMYK 100, 0, 0, 45

Denim Blue

Denim Blue (#2243B6) is a vibrant, medium-dark blue that reflects the color of new, unwashed indigo-dyed denim. It is a strong, classic, and casual shade. This color symbolizes durability, casual style, and rugged authenticity. As a result, Denim Blue is ubiquitous in jeans manufacturing, workwear branding, and Americana-themed designs.

  • HEX #2243B6
  • RGB 34, 67, 182
  • CMYK 81, 63, 0, 29

Deep Sky Blue

Deep Sky Blue (#00BFFF) is a brilliant, intense azure that is the deepest and most saturated of the “sky blue” family, identical to Capri. It is a vivid, pure, and cheerful blue. This color embodies boundless optimism, clear horizons, and joyful brightness. Consequently, Deep Sky Blue is used in aviation insignia, summer advertising, and designs requiring a powerful splash of positive color.

  • HEX #00BFFF
  • RGB 0, 191, 255
  • CMYK 100, 25, 0, 0

Duck Egg Blue

Duck Egg Blue (#C3D6E4) is a very pale, soft blue with a distinct gray-green undertone, mimicking the shell of certain duck eggs. It is a quiet, soothing, and vintage-inspired shade. This color suggests subtle charm, natural simplicity, and rustic elegance. Therefore, Duck Egg Blue is a favorite in shabby chic interiors, heritage craft projects, and delicate ceramic glazes.

  • HEX #C3D6E4
  • RGB 195, 214, 228
  • CMYK 14, 6, 0, 11

Federal Blue

Federal Blue (#2C3E5D) is a very dark, grayish blue used historically in official U.S. government contexts, including early naval uniforms. It is a somber, authoritative, and formal shade. This color represents governmental authority, historical tradition, and sober duty. Consequently, Federal Blue appears in historical recreations, official document design, and traditional uniform accents.

  • HEX #2C3E5D
  • RGB 44, 62, 93
  • CMYK 53, 33, 0, 64

Horizon Blue

Horizon Blue (#289DBE) is a medium, clear azure that captures the color of the sky just above the horizon on a clear day. It is a hopeful, expansive, and calming shade. This color evokes new possibilities, distant journeys, and peaceful vistas. Thus, Horizon Blue is effective in travel agency branding, wellness apps, and inspirational media.

  • HEX #289DBE
  • RGB 40, 157, 190
  • CMYK 79, 17, 0, 25

Iceberg Blue

Iceberg Blue (#7EC4CF) is a pale, cool blue-green that mimics the color of glacial ice in shadowed crevasses. It is a distinctly cold, serene, and pristine shade. This color suggests isolated beauty, chilling calm, and environmental fragility. Therefore, Iceberg Blue is used in climate change campaigns, winter cosmetic lines, and designs aiming for a crisp, clean, cool aesthetic.

  • HEX #7EC4CF
  • RGB 126, 196, 207
  • CMYK 39, 5, 0, 19

Imperial Blue

Imperial Blue (#005A92) is a deep, rich blue associated with imperial robes and regalia, particularly in historical European contexts. It is a luxurious, commanding, and traditional dark blue. This color symbolizes sovereign power, luxury, and historic grandeur. As a result, Imperial Blue is used in heraldry, theatrical costumes for royalty, and high-end packaging.

  • HEX #005A92
  • RGB 0, 90, 146
  • CMYK 100, 38, 0, 43

International Klein Blue

International Klein Blue (#002FA7) is a deep, matte ultramarine blue trademarked by French artist Yves Klein. He developed it to represent the concept of immaterial space and infinity. This color embodies artistic philosophy, pure sensation, and spiritual depth. Consequently, it is primarily used in modern art contexts, artistic installations, and designs referencing Klein’s radical work.

  • HEX #002FA7
  • RGB 0, 47, 167
  • CMYK 100, 72, 0, 35

Lapis Lazuli

Lapis Lazuli (#26619C) is a deep, moderately dark blue based on the semi-precious stone historically ground to make the precious ultramarine pigment. It often contains visible flecks of pyrite (gold). This color represents celestial truth, wisdom, and historical value. Therefore, Lapis Lazuli is used in jewelry design, mystical art, and designs needing a connection to antiquity and the cosmos.

  • HEX #26619C
  • RGB 38, 97, 156
  • CMYK 76, 38, 0, 39

Marine Blue

Marine Blue (#0F3861) is a very dark blue, almost black, used in various naval and maritime services. It is darker and more neutral than navy blue. This color conveys professional seamanship, disciplined order, and the deep sea. Thus, Marine Blue is a standard for official naval uniforms, ship hull paint, and maritime engineering.

  • HEX #0F3861
  • RGB 15, 56, 97
  • CMYK 85, 42, 0, 62

Moonstone Blue

Moonstone Blue (#8AAEC3) is a soft, grayish-blue reminiscent of the iridescent gemstone moonstone. It is a cool, ethereal, and subtly shifting shade. This color suggests mystery, intuition, and feminine calm. Consequently, Moonstone Blue is popular in spiritual wellness branding, fantasy-themed art, and jewelry design for its soft, magical quality.

  • HEX #8AAEC3
  • RGB 138, 174, 195
  • CMYK 29, 11, 0, 24

Moroccan Blue

Moroccan Blue (#5D8AA8) is a vibrant medium blue infused with a hint of green, inspired by the painted doors, tiles, and textiles of Morocco, especially in Chefchaouen. This color represents exotic beauty, cultural richness, and Mediterranean vibrancy. Therefore, Moroccan Blue is used in bohemian decor, travel posters, and craft projects to evoke a sense of exotic escape.

  • HEX #5D8AA8
  • RGB 93, 138, 168
  • CMYK 45, 18, 0, 34

Nile Blue

Nile Blue (#1A6F7F) is a dark, greenish-blue inspired by the deep, fertile waters of the River Nile. It is a rich, earthy, and historic shade. This color evokes ancient civilization, life-giving water, and fertile abundance. Consequently, Nile Blue appears in Egyptian-themed designs, historical artifacts, and nature-inspired palettes for a sense of ancient vitality.

  • HEX #1A6F7F
  • RGB 26, 111, 127
  • CMYK 80, 13, 0, 50

Non Photo Blue

Non Photo Blue (#A4DDED) is a pale, light blue that is designed not to be detected by graphic arts camera film, used traditionally for pre-print markings. It is a specific technical shade. This color represents practical utility, behind-the-scenes work, and graphic design history. Thus, it is used in drafting, animation, and layout planning as a non-reproducible guide.

  • HEX #A4DDED
  • RGB 164, 221, 237
  • CMYK 31, 7, 0, 7

Oxford Blue

Oxford Blue (#002147) is an extremely dark blue, almost black, officially used by the University of Oxford. It is one of the darkest shades of blue recognized as a distinct color. This color symbolizes academic excellence, ancient tradition, and profound knowledge. Therefore, Oxford Blue is central to university branding, formal academic dress, and designs requiring deep, intellectual seriousness.

  • HEX #002147
  • RGB 0, 33, 71
  • CMYK 100, 54, 0, 72

Pacific Cyan

Pacific Cyan (#4DBCE9) is a bright, clean cyan with a slight green tint, reminiscent of the shallow waters of a Pacific atoll. It is a cheerful, clear, and refreshing shade. This color suggests crystal-clear water, digital clarity, and sunny optimism. As a result, Pacific Cyan is used in summer marketing, tech app icons, and swimwear design.

  • HEX #4DBCE9
  • RGB 77, 188, 233
  • CMYK 67, 19, 0, 9

Persian Blue

Persian Blue (#1C39BB) is a bright, slightly purplish medium blue historically used in Persian carpets, miniatures, and architecture. It is a vibrant, rich, and cultural shade. This color represents artistic heritage, spiritual depth, and regal beauty. Consequently, Persian Blue is used in ethnic patterns, fine art, and designs evoking Middle Eastern craftsmanship.

  • HEX #1C39BB
  • RGB 28, 57, 187
  • CMYK 85, 70, 0, 27

Phthalo Blue

Phthalo Blue (#000F89) is an intense, extremely saturated dark blue-green, a modern synthetic pigment known for its incredible tinting strength and permanence. It is a staple on artists’ palettes. This color embodies vibrant power, modern chemistry, and artistic versatility. Therefore, Phthalo Blue is essential in fine art paints, industrial inks, and vivid design work where a powerful, greenish blue is needed.

  • HEX #000F89
  • RGB 0, 15, 137
  • CMYK 100, 89, 0, 46

Polo Blue

Polo Blue (#8AAEC3) is a medium, dusty grayish-blue associated with the classic polo shirt, particularly from brands like Ralph Lauren. It is a preppy, sporty, and casual shade. This color suggests country club style, relaxed elegance, and traditional sport. Consequently, Polo Blue is a staple in preppy fashion, casual branded merchandise, and upscale athletic wear.

  • HEX #8AAEC3
  • RGB 138, 174, 195
  • CMYK 29, 11, 0, 24

Queen Blue

Queen Blue (#436B95) is a medium-dark azure, slightly softer and more muted than royal blue. It is a dignified, calm, and traditional shade. This color represents refined authority, graceful leadership, and classic femininity. Thus, Queen Blue is used in heraldic designs, formal event decor, and branding aiming for a noble yet approachable feel.

  • HEX #436B95
  • RGB 67, 107, 149
  • CMYK 55, 28, 0, 42

Resolution Blue

Resolution Blue (#002387) is a deep, vivid blue that is both intense and clear, without being dark. It is a bold, confident, and modern shade. This color evokes decisive action, clarity of purpose, and dynamic energy. Therefore, Resolution Blue is effective in corporate logos calling for action, tech startup branding, and motivational media.

  • HEX #002387
  • RGB 0, 35, 135
  • CMYK 100, 74, 0, 47

Riviera Blue

Riviera Blue (#65A2D0) is a bright, cheerful medium blue inspired by the sunny skies and coastal waters of the French and Italian Riviera. It is a vacation-inspired, luxurious, and happy shade. This color symbolizes leisure, Mediterranean luxury, and sunny escapism. As a result, Riviera Blue is popular in travel advertising, resort wear, and interior design for a light, airy, upscale feel.

  • HEX #65A2D0
  • RGB 101, 162, 208
  • CMYK 51, 22, 0, 18

Royal Azure

Royal Azure (#0038A8) is a deep, vivid blue that is a more saturated and intense variant of royal blue, leaning slightly towards azure. It is a majestic, powerful, and eye-catching shade. This color represents supreme authority, vibrant tradition, and regal confidence. Consequently, Royal Azure is used in ceremonial flags, high-impact branding, and theatrical costumes for royalty.

  • HEX #0038A8
  • RGB 0, 56, 168
  • CMYK 100, 67, 0, 34

Santorini Blue

Santorini Blue (#4F7CB8) is a bright, warm medium blue that captures the iconic color of the church domes on the Greek island of Santorini against the Aegean Sea. It is a picturesque, iconic, and joyful shade. This color evokes Greek island holidays, stunning vistas, and cultural charm. Therefore, Santorini Blue is ubiquitous in travel imagery, souvenir design, and Mediterranean-themed decor.

  • HEX #4F7CB8
  • RGB 79, 124, 184
  • CMYK 57, 33, 0, 28

Space Blue

Space Blue (#1D2951) is a very dark, slightly desaturated blue that mimics the color of the night sky in space, as seen from Earth. It is a mysterious, infinite, and cool shade. This color suggests the cosmos, exploration, and the unknown. Thus, Space Blue is used in astronomy themes, sci-fi interfaces, and designs aiming for a deep, futuristic, or cosmic atmosphere.

  • HEX #1D2951
  • RGB 29, 41, 81
  • CMYK 64, 49, 0, 68

Steel Teal

Steel Teal (#5F8A8B) is a medium grayish blue-green, resembling weathered steel with a teal patina. It is a sophisticated, industrial, and nature-blended shade. This color embodies resilient elegance, industrial chic, and natural harmony. Consequently, Steel Teal is chosen for modern architecture, upscale tech products, and contemporary fashion with an edge.

  • HEX #5F8A8B
  • RGB 95, 138, 139
  • CMYK 32, 1, 0, 45

Tiffany Turquoise

Tiffany Turquoise (#81D8D0) is a light, bright greenish-blue used by Tiffany & Co., often confused with the classic Tiffany Blue but distinctly more green. It is a fresh, luxurious, and summery shade. This color represents upscale leisure, vibrant luxury, and coastal elegance. Therefore, it appears in Tiffany’s jewelry collections, high-end resort branding, and sophisticated summer fashion.

  • HEX #81D8D0
  • RGB 129, 216, 208
  • CMYK 40, 0, 4, 15

Twilight Blue

Twilight Blue (#0A437A) is a deep, dusky blue that captures the sky in the fleeting moments after sunset, just before nightfall. It is a serene, contemplative, and slightly melancholic shade. This color evokes transition, quiet reflection, and the end of the day. Consequently, Twilight Blue is used in poetic or literary designs, evening event themes, and serene landscape art.

  • HEX #0A437A
  • RGB 10, 67, 122
  • CMYK 92, 45, 0, 52

United Nations Blue

United Nations Blue (#5B92E5) is a soft, medium azure used in the emblem and flag of the United Nations. It is a clear, peaceful, and diplomatic shade. This color symbolizes international cooperation, global peace, and hopeful dialogue. Therefore, United Nations Blue is used in diplomatic contexts, NGO branding, and designs promoting unity and humanitarian ideals.

  • HEX #5B92E5
  • RGB 91, 146, 229
  • CMYK 60, 36, 0, 10

Venetian Blue

Venetian Blue (#2C5778) is a rich, dark greenish-blue inspired by the deep canals and historic glasswork of Venice, Italy. It is an artistic, historic, and watery shade. This color represents artistic heritage, romantic history, and aquatic depth. Thus, Venetian Blue appears in Murano glass art, Renaissance-themed designs, and elegant interior accents.

  • HEX #2C5778
  • RGB 44, 87, 120
  • CMYK 63, 28, 0, 53

Water Blue

Water Blue (#A4DCE6) is a very pale, clean cyan that looks like sunlit, shallow freshwater. It is a transparent, refreshing, and pure shade. This color suggests purity, refreshment, and simple clarity. Consequently, Water Blue is commonly used in bottled water branding, spa and hygiene products, and healthcare graphics for a clean, trustworthy impression.

  • HEX #A4DCE6
  • RGB 164, 220, 230
  • CMYK 29, 4, 0, 10

Winter Sky

Winter Sky (#A3D5EE) is a pale, icy blue with a slight gray tint, reminiscent of a clear, cold winter day’s sky. It is a crisp, bright, and chilly shade. This color embodies cold brightness, seasonal freshness, and crisp air. Therefore, Winter Sky is ideal for winter fashion collections, holiday marketing, and designs needing a cool, invigorating feel.

  • HEX #A3D5EE
  • RGB 163, 213, 238
  • CMYK 32, 11, 0, 7

Yacht Blue

Yacht Blue (#2C6FBB) is a crisp, bright medium blue associated with the hulls and accents of luxury yachts and sailing clubs. It is a sporty, nautical, and affluent shade. This color evokes maritime leisure, prestigious sport, and open-water freedom. Consequently, Yacht Blue is used in nautical flags, sailing apparel logos, and luxury marine branding.

  • HEX #2C6FBB
  • RGB 44, 111, 187
  • CMYK 76, 41, 0, 27

Arctic Blue

Arctic Blue (#82CFFD) is a bright, icy light blue that captures the color of glacial ice and frigid Arctic skies. It is a very cool, clean, and stark shade. This color suggests extreme cold, pristine environments, and isolated beauty. Therefore, Arctic Blue is effective in environmental science visuals, winter sports gear, and designs aiming for a pure, frosty aesthetic.

  • HEX #82CFFD
  • RGB 130, 207, 253
  • CMYK 49, 18, 0, 1

Electric Cyan

Electric Cyan (#00FFFF) is a fully saturated, intensely bright cyan that is identical to the web colors Cyan and Aqua. It is the pure, unmixed hue between green and blue. This color represents maximum vibrancy, digital radiance, and electric energy. As a result, Electric Cyan is a fundamental color in digital art, rave culture aesthetics, and high-visibility safety gear.

  • HEX #00FFFF
  • RGB 0, 255, 255
  • CMYK 100, 0, 0, 0

Deep Ocean Blue

Deep Ocean Blue (#1A5F7A) is a very dark, greenish-blue that represents the profound depths of the open ocean where sunlight barely penetrates. It is a mysterious, powerful, and enveloping shade. This color embodies profound mystery, immense pressure, and unexplored frontiers. Consequently, it is used in deep-sea exploration themes, dramatic nautical design, and packaging for premium, dark products.

  • HEX #1A5F7A
  • RGB 26, 95, 122
  • CMYK 79, 22, 0, 52

Classic Navy

Classic Navy (#0A1172) is a very dark blue that is the definitive, traditional shade of navy, used for centuries in military and formal contexts. It is the benchmark for conservative dark blue. This color symbolizes enduring tradition, unwavering duty, and timeless style. Thus, Classic Navy is a perpetual staple in formalwear, corporate branding, and classic automotive finishes.

  • HEX #0A1172
  • RGB 10, 17, 114
  • CMYK 91, 85, 0, 55

seo.title: Shades of Blue Color: Names, Codes, Meanings and Uses | HexColorMeans
